title: real analysis - About an estimate of an oblique derivative problem of Laplace's equation
body:
Suppose $n\geq 2$ , set $B=B_r(0)\subset \mathbb{R}^n$ , $B^+=\{x\in B|x_n>0\}$ , $H=\{x\in B|x_n=0\}$ , Let $u\in C^\infty(B^+)\cap C^1(B^+\cup H)$ be a solution of the following oblique derivative problem: $$ egin{cases} \Delta u=0 & 	ext{in} & B^+,\ au+ eta\cdot
abla u=0 & 	ext{on} & H, \end{cases}$$ where the constant $a\leq 0$ , $ eta$ is a constant vector with the $n$ -th component $ eta_n>0$ . Then $u$ can be uniquely extended to a harmoic function on $B'=B_{\lambda r}(0)$ , where $\lambda= eta_n/| eta|$ . In fact, let $v=au+ eta\cdot
abla u$ on $B^+\cup H$ , and $v(x',-x_n)=-v(x',x_n)$ , then $v$ is harmonic on $B$ ; for any $x_0\in H$ , let $$u(x_0+t eta)=e^{-at}(u(x_0)+\int_0^t v(x_0+s eta)e^{as}ds)$$ whenever $x_0+t eta\in B$ , then it's easy to check $u$ is smooth and harmonic in $B'$ , and coincides with the previous $u$ in $B'\cap \{x_n\geq 0\}$ . The question is: Does the following estimate necessarily hold, where $C$ is a positive constant independent of $u$ ? $$\sup_{B'}|u|\leq C\sup_{B^+}|u|$$ I guessed it's true but could not find the answer. If it's indeed true, please give a sketch of proof, if not, I also want to see the reason. real-analysis ap.analysis-of-pdes elliptic-pde Share Cite Improve this question Follow edited Jul 31, 2020 at 16:52 asked Jul 31, 2020 at 9:03 lzcsl 11 2 2 bronze badges $\endgroup$ 3 $ egingroup$ Erm...
